## About Me

I am a <span style="color: #B31B1B;">**doctoral candidate at Cornell University**</span>, specializing in <span style="color: #34568B;">**systems design**</span>, <span style="color: #34568B;">**engineering**</span>, and <span style="color: #34568B;">**optimization**</span>. My work focuses on leveraging **computational modeling**, **optimization****interdisciplinary approaches** to advance <span style="color: #3A7D44;">**sustainable technologies**</span>. As a member of the **Symbiotic Engineering and Analysis (SEA) Lab**, I collaborate on developing innovative solutions for offshore systems

With a Master's degree in <span style="color: #34568B;">**Systems Engineering**</span> and ongoing PhD work, I aim to bridge <span style="color: #3A7D44;">**theory and applications**</span> for <span style="color: #34568B;">**large-scale systems**</span>.

## Research Focus

My research lives at the intersection of:
- **Multidisciplinary Design Optimization (MDO)**
- **Differentiable Hydrodynamics & PDE-Constrained Optimization**
- **Adjoint-Based Sensitivity Analysis**
- **Scientific Machine Learning**

I develop and apply gradient-based optimization methods to complex engineering problems, from renewable energy systems to aerospace structures.
